visualization_prompt: Generate a column chart showing high-volume signal data with multi-frequency oscillations and random spikes using Highcharts Boost module for high-performance rendering
visualization_explanation: The dataset represents a univariate time series with 500,000 numerical observations. Synthetic data combines three components: 1) Base sine wave (period=100 samples), 2) Medium-term amplitude variations (every 1,000 samples), 3) Random spikes (Poisson-distributed occurrences). Data quality is controlled through parameterized noise injection (σ=0.35) and amplitude clamping to prevent signal saturation. The column chart visualization emphasizes discrete sampling characteristics while the Boost module employs WebGL acceleration for large dataset rendering. Following Tufte's principles, the minimal gridlines and direct labeling maximize data-ink ratio. Color choice (#3498db) optimizes perceptual discriminability according to Cairo's guidelines. Spike amplitudes (μ=9.8V, σ=2.1) follow Rayleigh distribution modeling rare high-energy events in signal processing contexts.
